textContent:
Druids consider that, for a long time, nature has been dying at the hands of civilization, pyromaniacs. Fire is strictly forbidden. The spirits of nature are only half-living, and thus the gifts they grant are tainted by their condition. Necromancy is, therefore, both the unstoppable urge of Nature to keep living and a force of retribution for Nature. Giant micellium under the earth, waiting, feeding on dead matter and controlling their husk.

It may be because since the discovery of food conjuration, nature has been deemed redundant, and has been neglected so much it fights back.
